required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Appropriate Dose of Neostigmine for Reversal of Rocuronium and Cisatracurium
clinical_study.official_title: Appropriate Dose of Neostigmine for Reversal of Rocuronium and Cisatracurium

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to find appropriate dose of neostigmine which is possible to reverse rocuronium or cisatracurium till train of four (TOF) 0.9 within 10 minutes.

primary_outcome.measure: time to reverse from light muscle relaxation
primary_outcome.time_frame: time from TOF 0.5 to TOF 1.0 after injection of different doses of neostigmine
primary_outcome.description: Primary outcome of this study is how long it takes time to reverse from TOF ratio 0.5 to 1.0 after injection of different doses of neostigmine at the TOF 0.5

secondary_outcome.measure: time to reverse from TOF ratio 0.5 to 0.9
secondary_outcome.time_frame: time from TOF 0.5 to TOF 0.9 after injection of different doses of neostigmine
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary outcome of this study is how long it takes time to reverse from TOF ratio 0.5 to 0.9 after injection of different doses of neostigmine at the TOF 0.5

arm_group.description: At anesthetic induction, rocuronium 0.6 mg/kg will be injected for muscle relaxation. During surgical procedure, we will monitor train of four (TOF) using nerve stimulator. When TOF ratio recover to 0.5, normal saline 5 ml will be injected. And we will measure time to take from TOF ratio 0.5 to 1.0

At anesthetic induction, rocuronium 0.6 mg/kg will be injected for muscle relaxation. During surgical procedure, we will monitor train of four(TOF)using nerve stimulator. When TOF ratio recover to 0.5, neostigmine 10 ㎍/kg will be injected. And we will measure time to take from TOF ratio 0.5 to 1.0.

At anesthetic induction, rocuronium 0.6 mg/kg will be injected for muscle relaxation. During surgical procedure, we will monitor train of four(TOF)using nerve stimulator. When TOF ratio recover to 0.5, neostigmine 20 ㎍/kg will be injected. And we will measure time to take from TOF ratio 0.5 to 1.0

At anesthetic induction, rocuronium 0.6 mg/kg will be injected for muscle relaxation. During surgical procedure, we will monitor train of four(TOF)using nerve stimulator. When TOF ratio recover to 0.5, neostigmine 40 ㎍/kg will be injected. And we will measure time to take from TOF ratio 0.5 to 1.0

At anesthetic induction, cisatracurium 0.15 mg/kg will be injected for muscle relaxation. During surgical procedure, we will monitor train of four(TOF)using nerve stimulator. When TOF ratio recover to 0.5, normal saline 5 ml will be injected. And we will measure time to take from TOF ratio 0.5 to 1.0

At anesthetic induction, cisatracurium 0.15 mg/kg will be injected for muscle relaxation. During surgical procedure, we will monitor train of four(TOF)using nerve stimulator. When TOF ratio recover to 0.5, neostigmine 10 ㎍/kg will be injected. And we will measure time to take from TOF ratio 0.5 to 1.0

At anesthetic induction, cisatracurium 0.15 mg/kg will be injected for muscle relaxation. During surgical procedure, we will monitor train of four(TOF)using nerve stimulator. When TOF ratio recover to 0.5, neostigmine 20 ㎍/kg will be injected. And we will measure time to take from TOF ratio 0.5 to 1.0

At anesthetic induction, cisatracurium 0.15 mg/kg will be injected for muscle relaxation. During surgical procedure, we will monitor train of four(TOF)using nerve stimulator. When TOF ratio recover to 0.5, neostigmine 40 ㎍/kg will be injected. And we will measure time to take from TOF ratio 0.5 to 1.0

intervention.description: At induction, we will inject rocuronium 0.6 mg/kg for rocuronium arms and cisatracurium 0.15 mg/kg for cisatracurium arms. During surgical procedure, we will monitor train of four(TOF)using nerve stimulator. When TOF ratio recover to 0.5, normal saline 5 ml will be injected in placebo arms. And neostigmine 10, 20, or 40 ㎍/kg will injected in each arms.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologist Physical status classification 1 or 2 elective surgery under general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI >25 or < 20 kg/m2
- Patients taking intercurrent medication
- Glutamic Oxalacetate Transaminase or Glutamic Pyruvate Transaminase > 40 IU/L, Cr > 1.4 mg/dl
